articles.author: JON GAMBRELL, ADAM SCHRECK and TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israel attacked military targets in Iran with pre-dawn airstrikes Saturday in retaliation for the barrage of ballistic missiles the Islamic Republic fired on Israel earlier this month.
articles.title: Israel's first open attack on Iran targets missile sites and apparently spares oil and nuclear ones

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — An attack on an Iranian police convoy Saturday in the country's restive southern province of Sistan and Baluchestan killed at least 10 officers, authorities said.
articles.title: Attack on a police convoy in a restive southeastern province of Iran kills 10 officers

articles.author: CHRISTINA A. CASSIDY
articles.description: RENO, Nev. (AP) — One morning last month, Cari-Ann Burgess did something completely unremarkable: She made a quick stop at a coffee shop on her way to work.For Burgess, the top election official in a northern Nevada county, such outings could be precarious.
articles.title: An elections worker wanted to serve her country. A stew of conspiracy theories and vitriol awaited

articles.author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE, COLLEEN LONG and NADIA LATHAN
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — Kamala Harris and Beyoncé ignited a Houston rally with a double-barreled argument against Donald Trump on Friday, with the superstar telling the Democratic nominee’s biggest crowd ever that it was “time to sing a new song” as Harris warned that her GOP opponent was dead set on further eroding women’s rights.
articles.title: Harris and Beyoncé ignite a Houston rally with a double-barreled argument against Trump

articles.author: JILL COLVIN, JONATHAN J. COOPER and WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich. (AP) — Many of Donald Trump’s supporters left a Michigan rally before he arrived after the former president kept them waiting for three hours to tape a popular podcast interview.
articles.title: Trump leaves Michigan rallygoers waiting in the cold for hours to tape Joe Rogan podcast

articles.author: EMMA BURROWS
articles.description: TBILISI, Georgia (AP) — Polls closed in Georgia Saturday after an election many citizens saw as a make-or-break vote on the opportunity to join the European Union.The pre-election campaign in the South Caucasus nation of 3.7 million people which borders Russia was dominated by foreign policy and marked by a bitter fight for votes and allegations of a smear campaign.
articles.title: Polls close in Georgia's election that could take it toward the EU or into Russia's orbit

articles.author: GARANCE BURKE and HILKE SCHELLMANN
articles.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Tech behemoth OpenAI has touted its artificial intelligence-powered transcription tool Whisper as having near “human level robustness and accuracy.”But Whisper has a major flaw: It is prone to making up chunks of text or even entire sentences, according to interviews with more than a dozen software engineers, developers and academic researchers.
articles.title: Researchers say an AI-powered transcription tool used in hospitals invents things no one ever said

articles.author: REBECCA SANTANA
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Sixteen-year-old Billy's friends at his rural high school in the South don't know he was one of thousands of children separated from their parents at the U.S.-Mexico border under then-President Donald Trump's zero tolerance immigration policy.
articles.title: Migrant families separated under Trump still feel the fallout and they fear his return to office

articles.author: BETH HARRIS
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A nail-biter all night with a Hollywood ending. Game 1 of Yankees-Dodgers certainly delivered.Freddie Freeman hit the first game-ending grand slam in World Series history with two outs in the 10th inning to give the Los Angeles Dodgers a 6-3 victory over the New York Yankees in a drama-filled opener Friday.
articles.title: Freeman hits 1st walk-off slam in World Series history as Dodgers top Yankees 6-3 in classic opener

articles.author: VANESSA GERA, JAN M. OLSEN and STEFANIE DAZIO
articles.description: COPENHAGEN (AP) — Nearly 30 years after they killed their parents, Erik and Lyle Menendez launched a beautification project in the California prison where they're serving life sentences.
articles.title: The Menendez brothers built a green space in prison. It’s modeled on this Norwegian idea
